document.docAuthor: Barbosa, Diego N. & Azevedo, Celso O.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Mesitiinae (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Madagascar, with description of eleven new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Mesitiinae (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Madagascar, with description of eleven new species

heading.emphasis: Key to Mesitiinae species from Madagascar

treatment.paragraph:
Males (unknown for
Codorcas antanosy
sp. nov.
and
Pycnomesitius tanala
sp. nov.
)

paragraph.keyLead:
- Propodeum without posterior spine (
Fig. 24
)...............................................
C. zafimaniry
sp. nov.

5 . Body castaneous; head with frontal carina ( Figs 17 ,
19– 21
)......................................
C. merina
sp. nov.

- Body dark castaneous nearly black; head without frontal carina (
Figs 9–16
)...........................
C. bara
sp. nov.

6 . Macropterous (
Fig. 1
); fore wing without costal vein...........................................
A. betsileo
sp. nov.

7 . Macropterous (
Fig. 26
) propodeal disc without longitudinal ridge between median and inner discal carina (
Fig. 31
).............................................................................................
I. antaimoro
sp. nov.

- Micropterous (
Fig. 33
); propodeal disc with longitudinal ridge between median and inner discal carina (
Fig. 36
)...................................................................................................
I. mikea
sp. nov.

8 . Metasomal tergum 2 densely granulated (
Fig. 51
)..............................
Pilomesitius madagascarensis
Móczár

9 . Flagellomere 1 at least 2.0 × longer than others (
Fig. 43
); mesoscutum without longitudinal mesoscutal furrow (
Fig. 44
)...........................................................................................
Z. makoa
sp. nov.
- Flagellomere 1 at most 1.2 × longer than others; mesoscutum with longitudinal mesoscutal furrow ( Figs 47 , 55 )......... 10

10 . Median carina of propodeal disc complete (
Fig. 55
); hind wing with five distal hamuli.......
Z. madagascarensis (Móczár)

- Median carina of propodeal disc incomplete (
Fig. 47
); hind wing with three distal hamuli.............
Z. sakalava
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Females (unknown for
Anaylax betsileo
sp. nov.
,
A. mahafaly
sp. nov.
,
Clytrovorus merina
sp. nov.
,
C. zafimaniry
sp. nov.
,
Itapayaos antaimoro
sp. nov.
,
I. mikea
sp. nov.
,
Zimankos makoa
sp. nov.
,
Z. sakalava
sp. nov.
)

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . Macropterous; metasomal tergum 2 densely punctured (
Fig. 34
).........................
Pycnomesitius tanala
sp. nov.

- Brachypterous (
Fig. 49
); metasomal tergum 2 densely lineated and hairy (
Fig. 51
)....
Pilomesitius madagascarensis
Móczár

3 . Propodeal disc without inner discal carina (
Fig. 28
)......................................
Codorcas antanosy
sp. nov.

4 . Propodeal disc without sublateral and lateral carinae (
Fig. 15
)..............................
Clytrovorus bara
sp. nov.

- Propodeal disc with sublateral and lateral carinae...............................
Zimankos madagascarensis (Móczár)
